APP_NAME.description: Specific brand name of the application, if any.

APP_LOGO_URL.description: The URL of the image to be displayed in UI as App logo in the top left corner.

BACKEND_URL.description: The URL of the root folder (mapped with `./public`), with the scheme but without trailing slash (no path).

CIPHER_KEY.description: Private key to use for secrets decryption. This property should be defined before any encryption/decryption operation.

DEFAULT_LANG.description: The language in which the content must be displayed by default (ISO 639-1).

DEFAULT_PACKAGE.description: Package we'll try to access if nothing is specified in the url (typically while accessing root URL).

DEFAULT_APP.description: Default App to request from default package.

ROUTING_METHOD.description: Method to use for parsing the URIs. Possible values are: 'ORM' or 'JSON' (router.json).

FILE_STORAGE_MODE.description: Storage mode for binary content. Possible values are: 'DB' (database) and 'FS' (filesystem).

DEFAULT_RIGHTS.description: Rights to grant to any user when no ACL is defined.

DEBUG_MODE.description: Classes of report-messages to log (non-matching messages are ignored).

DEBUG_LEVEL.description: Types of error to report (defaults to E_ALL = 32767, setting to 0 means no logs). Important: if logging level is set to E_ALL with all mode enabled, then the log file will grow quickly.

HTTP_REQUEST_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum wait time, in seconds, before cancelling a pending HTTP request. Must not exceed `max_execution_time`.

EMAIL_SMTP_HOST.description: Hostname of the SMTP server to use for sending emails.

EMAIL_SMTP_PORT.description: Port to use for SMTP connections.

EMAIL_SMTP_ENCRYPT.description: Encryption layer to use for SMTP connections ('tls' or 'ssl', false for SMTP with no encryption)

EMAIL_SMTP_ACCOUNT_USERNAME.description: Account name (or email address) to use to authentify to SMTP server.

EMAIL_SMTP_ACCOUNT_PASSWORD.description: Password to use to authentify to SMTP server.

EMAIL_SMTP_ACCOUNT_EMAIL.description: Email address to use as sender (must be allowed by SMTP server).

DB_REPLICATION.description: Strategy to apply for database replication. Possible values are: 'NO': no replication; 'MS' ('master-slave', 2 servers) write operations are performed on both servers, read operations are performed on the master only; 'MM' ('multi-master'): any number of servers; write operations are performed on all servers, read operations can be performed on any server

DB_DBMS.description: Database Management System running on the DB host. Possible values are: 'MYSQL', 'SQLSRV', 'MARIADB', 'POSTGRESQL', 'ORACLE'

DB_CHARSET.description: Charset encoding to use when manipulating strings with DBMS. Possible values are: 'utf8' (3 bytes) or 'utf8mb4' (4 bytes).

DB_COLLATION.description: Collation to apply on SQL queries. Possible values are: 'utf8_unicode_ci' (3 bytes) or 'utf8mb4_unicode_ci' (4 bytes) in most cases.

DB_HOST.description: IP address or fully qualified domain name (ex.: sql.example.com) of the DB host.

DB_PORT.description: TCP/IP port for connecting to DB host. Default ports: MYSQL 3306, SQLSRV 1433

DB_USER.description: Login for authenticating on DB host.

DB_PASSWORD.description: Password for authenticating on DB host.

DB_NAME.description: the name of the DB that you've created or plan to use.

UPLOAD_MAX_FILE_SIZE.description: Maximum authorized size for file upload (in octet). Keep in mind that this parameter does not override the PHP 'upload_max_filesize' directive, o it can be more restrictive but will not be effective if set higher.

L10N_TIMEZONE.description: Preferred timezone for controllers that generate a static output. Locale params are only relevant for data controllers involving some output impacted by localization. By convention, timezone is always set to UTC for script processing (using `date_default_timezone_set('UTC');`).

L10N_LOCALE.description: Preferred locale for controllers that generate static output. Locale params are only relevant for data controllers involving some output impacted by localization.

LOGGING_ENABLED.description: Keep in mind that enabling logging increases I/O operations.

DRAFT_ENABLED.description: Reuse draft objects (created but not saved, having status left to 'draft').

DRAFT_VALIDITY.description: Duration in days before recycling draft objects.

AUTH_SECRET_KEY.description: Secret key used for hashing JWT data.

AUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN_VALIDITY.description: Validity duration of the access token, in seconds.

AUTH_TOKEN_HTTPS.description: Flag for limiting the sending of auth token to HTTPS.

ORG_NAME.description: Name of the organisation to which belongs the instance.

ORG_URL.description: URL of the official website of the organisation.

REST_API_URL.description: The URL specific to the API path, if any. This URL should end with a slash ('/')

USER_ACCOUNT_DISPLAYNAME.description: Strategy for displaying the user name to other users. The expected value is a string holding one or more of following references: 'id', 'nickname', 'mail', 'givenname', 'surname', 'initials' (Note: 'mail' is the email address and suits Apps restricted to users from a same organisation but should be avoided for non public profiles).

USER_ACCOUNT_REGISTRATION.description: Flag telling if everyone is allowed to create a new user account.

USER_ACCOUNT_VALIDATION.description: Flag telling if a new user account needs to be validated before being active.
